sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"会，会议"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: conference, congress, assembly, meeting, rally, council, session, convention, gathering
means: conference ： 正式用词，一般指大型会议，如政府工作会议、国际学术交流会议、各国之间的协商、会谈等。
congress ： 指国会、议会、代表大会等机构，尤指经选举产生的国家立法机构的大会或由这些机构召开的大会，也可指专业人员代表大会。
assembly ： 多指一个通常有许多人参加、计划好的，为某一特殊目的而召集的会议。
meeting ： 普通用词，词义广泛。指一般性的会议，可用于任何场合。
rally ： 指大规模的群众性政治集会。
council ： 在国际上多指由各国代表参加的政治会议，或常设的政治机构。在国内、地方上，此词多指常设的政务领导机构，如市政委员会等。
session ： 一般指议会等召开的正式会议。
convention ： 侧重指某一政党或团体为某一特殊目的而召开的会议；也可指学术团体的年会。
gathering ： 指两人以上的聚会或集会，强调非正式性。

sentence.Network_en: We were very keen when the 1954 Rally came round.
sentence.Network_cn: 1954年的集会开始时，我们都非常热切。

sentence.Network_en: The rally was organised at the instance of two senior cabinet ministers.
sentence.Network_cn: 集会是应两位资深内阁大臣的要求组织的。

sentence.Network_en: The immediate flashpoint was Wednesday's big rally in the city centre.
sentence.Network_cn: 星期三市中心的大集会成了直接的导火索。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in the sense 'bring together again'): from French rallier, from re- 'again' + allier 'to ally'
mid 17th cent.: from French railler 'to rib, tease' (see rail)

entry.def: A rally is a large public meeting that is held in order to show support for something such as a political party.

example.ex: About three thousand people held a rally to mark international human rights day...
example.tran: 大约3,000人举行了一场大会来庆祝国际人权日。

example.ex: Supporters of the policy are reported to be gathering in Delhi for a mass rally.
example.tran: 有报道说这项政策的拥护者要齐聚德里召开群众集会。

entry.def: When people rally to something or when something rallies them, they unite to support it.

example.ex: His supporters have rallied to his defence...
example.tran: 他的拥护者团结起来为他辩护。

example.ex: He rallied his own supporters for a fight.
example.tran: 他把自己的拥护者召集起来准备斗争。

entry.def: When someone or something rallies, they begin to recover or improve after having been weak.

example.ex: He rallied enough to thank his doctors...
example.tran: 他身体好得差不多了，于是去感谢他的医生。
世界各地的市场开始复苏。

entry.def: A rally is a competition in which vehicles are driven over public roads.

example.ex: Carlos Sainz of Spain has won the New Zealand Motor Rally.
example.tran: 西班牙人卡洛斯·赛恩斯在新西兰摩托车公路大赛中夺冠。
技术精湛的公路赛车手

entry.tran: （网球、羽毛球、壁球等的）连续对打
entry.def: A rally in tennis, badminton, or squash is a continuous series of shots that the players exchange without stopping.

means.word_mean: 1. a large gathering of people intended to arouse enthusiasm
2. the feat of mustering strength for a renewed effort;

sentences.sentence: "he singled to start a rally in the 9th inning"
"he feared the rallying of their troops for a counterattack"

means.word_mean: 3. a marked recovery of strength or spirits during an illness
4. an automobile race run over public roads
5. (sports) an unbroken sequence of several successive strokes;

sentences.sentence: "after a short rally Connors won the point"

means.word_mean: 2. call to arms; of military personnel

sentences.sentence: "The jilted lover soon rallied and found new friends"

means.word_mean: 5. harass with persistent criticism or carping;

sentences.sentence: "Don't ride me so hard over my failure"
"His fellow workers razzed him when he wore a jacket and tie"

auth_sentence.content: Tariq Elgady was among those who joined the rally.
auth_sentence.res_content: Tariq Elgady was among those who joined the rally.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Tariq Elgady was among those who joined the rally.

auth_sentence.content: Oil also joined in the rally in risk assets.
auth_sentence.res_content: Oil also joined in the rally in risk assets.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Oil also joined in the rally in risk assets.

auth_sentence.content: The rally will be biggest in Pakistan's history.
auth_sentence.res_content: The rally will be biggest in Pakistan's history.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The rally will be biggest in Pakistan's history.

Sentence.sentence: That looks like a protest rally.

sentences.en: They held a celebration rally.
sentences.cn: 他们举行了一次庆祝大会。

sentences.en: Some higher officials attended the celebration rally.
sentences.cn: 一些高级官员参加了庆祝大会。

sentences.en: He won the last week's rally.
sentences.cn: 他在上周赛车中获胜。

sentences.en: He attended two rallies last year.
sentences.cn: 去年他参加了两场汽车拉力赛。

sentences.en: The troops rallied.
sentences.cn: 部队重新集结。

sentences.en: The soldiers rallied at the foot of a hill.
sentences.cn: 战士们在一座小山脚下重新集结。

sentences.en: The enemy's forces rallied, and made a fresh attack on the town.
sentences.cn: 敌军重新调集兵力, 对该城发动了又一次进攻。

sentences.en: The leader rallied his scattered men.
sentences.cn: 指挥官重整溃兵。

sentences.en: The teacher rallied the pupils before setting out for the museum.
sentences.cn: 在出发参观博物馆之前, 教师把学生们集合起来。

sentences.en: All the villagers should be rallied to rescue the crops.
sentences.cn: 应该把全体村民动员起来抢救庄稼。

sentences.en: As the referee counted, the boxer rallied and got to his feet.
sentences.cn: 裁判在数点的时候, 那位拳击手恢复了体力, 站了起来。

sentences.en: The market will soon rally.
sentences.cn: 市场很快会繁荣起来。

sentences.en: The pound rallied just before the foreign exchange market closed.
sentences.cn: 外汇市场将要收盘时, 英镑价格回升了。

sentences.en: Before long the dying plants began to rally.
sentences.cn: 快要枯死的植物不久就开始复苏了。

sentences.en: She has rallied her spirits.
sentences.cn: 她已恢复了精神。

sentences.en: The Bank of England tried to rally the pound.
sentences.cn: 英格兰银行试图使英镑重新坚挺。

sentences.en: We must rally the broad masses of the people round the Party.
sentences.cn: 我们必须将广大人民群众团结在党的周围。

means.word_mean: 重振(精神等)；恢复(元气等)

sentences.en: They rallied their spirits and threw themselves into the battle.
sentences.cn: 他们重振精神投入战斗。

sentences.en: They tried to rally the pound sterling but in vain.
sentences.cn: 他们企图恢复英镑币值，但劳而无功。

sentences.en: The vast majority of the people rallied to the new government.
sentences.cn: 大多数人民站在新政府一边。

means.word_mean: 【网球、羽毛球】来回对打(为争夺一分而连续往返拍击)；赛前对打(作为准备活动)

sentences.en: They rallied for a long time at the set point of the first set.
sentences.cn: 在打到第一盘的决胜分时，他们来回对打了半天。
